wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Pringle (30 January 1791 – 2 September 1857) was a Scottish Conservative politician. He was Member of Parliament for Selkirkshire from 1830 to 1832 and again from 1835 to 1846. He was made a Lord of the Treasury in Peel's second ministry, but resigned in 1845 in protest at the decision to enhance the Maynooth Grant. After retiring from parliament he served as Principal Keeper of Sasines until his death.

response: Eliott-Lockhart was elected Conservative MP for Selkirkshire at a by-election in 1846—caused by the resignation of Alexander Pringle who had been appointed Clerk of Sasines—and held the seat until 1861, when he resigned by accepting the office of Steward of the Chiltern Hundreds.
